discussion.p: The definitions of compare and exchange in p32 and p20 state:

blockquote.p: Requires: The failure argument shall not be memory_order_release nor memory_order_acq_rel. The failure argument shall be no stronger than the success argument.

discussion.p:
The term "stronger" isn't defined by the standard.
It is hinted at by p21:

blockquote.p: When only one memory_order argument is supplied, the value of success is order, and the value of failure is order except that a value of memory_order_acq_rel shall be replaced by the value memory_order_acquire and a value of memory_order_release shall be replaced by the value memory_order_relaxed.

discussion.p: Should the standard define a partial ordering for memory orders, where consume and acquire are incomparable with release?
